Episodes.Title: For Those Who Think Young
Episodes.Plot: It?s Valentine?s Day, and the Sterling Cooper advertising agency is hustling to stay on top of its game and buzzing over the newest office equipment. Don and Duck find themselves at odds over an account. Betty reconnects with an old friend and once again finds herself struggling with car trouble.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Mark Moses, Joel Murray, Bryan Batt, Gabriel Mann, Anne Dudek

Episodes.Title: Flight 1
Episodes.Plot: Paul hosts a party at his apartment and introduces someone special to his Sterling Cooper colleagues. Peggy visits her family for dinner. Despite a conflict of interest, the Sterling Cooper agency aggressively pursues an airline account and Duck attempts to appeal to the client using an unorthodox approach.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Bryan Batt, Mark Moses, Joel Murray, Anne Dudek, Kristoffer Polaha

Episodes.Title: The Benefactor
Episodes.Plot: Trouble arises on the set of a commercial; Harry tries to gather support for a controversial sponsorship; Betty and Don try to appease a client with a friendly dinner.

Episodes.GuestStars: Mark Moses, Joel Murray, Melinda McGraw, Gabriel Mann, Crista Flanagan

Episodes.Title: Three Sundays
Episodes.Plot: Peggy's family hosts a lunch for their church's new priest; Don and Betty enjoy a weekend together; Freddy and Ken take a client out to lunch; the staff works to prepare for a last minute pitch meeting.

Episodes.GuestStars: Bryan Batt, Mark Moses, Colin Hanks, Melinda McGraw, Talia Balsam
